Package com.quantum.steps

Class PerfectoDeviceSteps

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.quantum.steps.PerfectoDeviceSteps
  • public class PerfectoDeviceSteps
extends Object
    The class PerfectoDeviceSteps provides methods for working with a device, with cucumber steps annotations.

    Example: Working with a device. 

     Scenario: 
        Given I go to the device home screen
        Then I open browser to webpage "https://community.perfectomobile.com/"
        Then I should see text "GETTING STARTED"
        Then I take a screenshot and save to PRIVATE:dir1/dir2/name.png
    Author:
    shanil
    See Also:
    BDD Implementation

      • rotateToLandscape

        @Then("^I rotate the device to landscape$")
public void rotateToLandscape()
        Rotates the device to landscape mode.

      • rotateToPortrait

        @Then("^I rotate the device to portrait$")
public void rotateToPortrait()
        Rotates the device to portrait mode.

      • rotateDevice

        @Then("^I rotate the device$")
public void rotateDevice()
        Rotates the device to its next state.

      • setLocationByCoordinates

        @Then("^I set the device location to the coordinates \"(.*?)\"$")
public void setLocationByCoordinates​(String coordinates)
        Sets the device location using latitude,longitude coordinates (decimal degrees) format. This enables testing a location-aware app that uses Location Services, without moving the device from place to place to generate location data.

        Confirm that the "Allow mock locations" setting is enabled. Go to: Settings, Developer options, Allow mock locations.

        Example: 43.642659,-79.387050

        Parameters:
        coordinates - the location coordinates to set

      • switchToDriver

        @Then("^I switch to driver \"([^\"]*)\"$")
public static void switchToDriver​(String driverName)
        This step will switch the current driver to the given driver name. The driver names can be perfecto, device2 or perfectoRemote, device2Remote respectively for Appium Mobile Driver and Remote Desktop Drivers. To use you must assign at least two parameter groups in your testNG config containing either capabilities assigned to a driver name or pointing to an env.resource file containing the set of capabilities associated with the driver name.

        Example:

        <parameter name="perfecto.capabilities.platformName" value="Android"/>

        <parameter name="perfecto.env.resources" value="src/main/resources/android2"/> *

        <parameter name="device2.capabilities.platformName" value="Android" />

        <parameter name="device2.env.resources" value="src/main/resources/android2" />

        Note: If AppiumDriver is set to true you must also have the appropriate Appium driver class assigned to the driver name

        <parameter name="perfecto.capabilities.driverClass" value="io.appium.java_client.android.AndroidDriver" />

        or

        <parameter name="device2.capabilities.driverClass" value="io.appium.java_client.ios.IOSDriver" />

        I switch to driver "perfecto"

        Parameters:
        driverName - The name of the driver you are switching to "perfecto" or "device2" or "perfectoRemote" or "device2Remote"

      • setLocationByAddress

        @Then("^I set the device location to the address \"(.*?)\"$")
public void setLocationByAddress​(String address)
        Sets the device location using address (Google Geocoding) format. This enables testing a location-aware app that uses Location Services, without moving the device from place to place to generate location data.

        Confirm that the "Allow mock locations" setting is enabled. Go to: Settings, Developer options, Allow mock locations.

        Example: 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA

        Parameters:
        address - the location address to set

      • assertLocationCoordinates

        @Then("^the device coordinates must be \"(.*?)\"$")
public void assertLocationCoordinates​(String coordinates)
        Checks the device location using latitude,longitude coordinates (decimal degrees) format. Stops the test in case of failure.

        Example: 43.642659,-79.387050

        Parameters:
        coordinates - the location coordinates to check

      • verifyLocationCoordinates

        @Then("^the device coordinates should be \"(.*?)\"$")
public boolean verifyLocationCoordinates​(String coordinates)
        Verifies the device location using latitude,longitude coordinates (decimal degrees) format. The test will continue to run in case of failure.

        Example: 43.642659,-79.387050

        Parameters:
        coordinates - the location coordinates to verify
        Returns:
        true if the location is verified, false otherwise

      • resetLocation

        @Then("^I reset the device location$")
public void resetLocation()
        Resets the device location. This command should be used after the setting the location to stop setting the device location.

        This operation returns the device to its current location.

      • goToHomeScreen

        @Then("^I go to the device home screen$")
public void goToHomeScreen()
        Brings the device to its idle / home screen. This is done by navigating the device back to the home screen.

        For iOS and Android devices, the device is unlocked and returned to its default rotate orientation.

        Use this command at the beginning of a script, to ensure a known starting point for the user.

      • swipeLeft

        @Then("^I swipe left$")
public void swipeLeft()
        Performs the swipe gesture to the left.

      • swipeRight

        @Then("^I swipe right")
public void swipeRight()
        Performs the swipe gesture to the right.

public void scrollUp()
        Performs the scroll up gesture.

public void scrollDown()
        Performs the scroll down gesture.

      • lockDevice

        @Then("^I lock the device for \"(\\d*\\.?\\d*)\" seconds$")
public void lockDevice​(int seconds)
        Locks the device screen for the duration set in seconds, and unlocks the device.
        Parameters:
        seconds - the lock screen duration

      • setTimezone

        @Then("^I set timezone to \"(.*?)\"")
public void setTimezone​(String timezone)
        Sets the device timezone.
        Parameters:
        timezone - the new timezone Id

      • assertTimezone

        @Then("^the device timezone must be \"(.*?)\"")
public void assertTimezone​(String timezone)
        Checks the device timezone. Stops the test in case of failure.
        Parameters:
        timezone - the new timezone Id to check

      • verifyTimezone

        @Then("^the device timezone should be \"(.*?)\"")
public boolean verifyTimezone​(String timezone)
        Verifies the device timezone. The test will continue to run in case of failure.
        Parameters:
        timezone - the timezone Id to verify
        Returns:
        true if the timezone is verified, false otherwise

      • resetTimezone

        @Then("^I reset the device timezone$")
public void resetTimezone()
        Resets the device timezone Id to the default.

      • takeScreenshot

        @Then("^I take a screenshot$")
public void takeScreenshot()
        Gets a digital screenshot of the current screen display, and places it in the report.

      • takeScreenshot

        @Then("^I take a screenshot and save to \"(.*?)\"$")
public void takeScreenshot​(String repositoryPath)
        Gets a digital screenshot of the current screen display, and saves it to the repository.
        Parameters:
        repositoryPath - the full repository path, including directory and file name, where to save the file. Example - PRIVATE:dir1/dir2/name.png

      • touch

        @Then("^I touch on \"(.*?)\" point$")
public static void touch​(String point)
        Performs the touch gesture according to the point coordinates.
        Parameters:
        point - write in format of x,y. can be in pixels or percentage(recommended) for example 50%,50%.

      • doubleTouch

public static void doubleTouch​(String point)

        Parameters:
        point - write in format of x,y. can be in pixels or percentage(recommended) for example 50%,50%.

public static void doubleClickElement​(String locator)

        Parameters:
        locator - write in format of x,y. can be in pixels or percentage(recommended) for example 50%,50%.

      • tapElement

        @Then("^I tap on \"(.*?)\" for \"(\\d*\\.?\\d*)\" seconds$")
public static void tapElement​(String locator,
                              int seconds)
        Performs the long touch gesture according to the point coordinates.
        Parameters:
        seconds - Duration of long touch in seconds.
        locator - write in format of x,y. can be in pixels or percentage(recommended) for example 50%,50%.

      • generateHar

        @Then("^Start generate Har file$")
public static void generateHar()
        Generate Har file. The HAR file will be included in the Reporting artifacts for the automation report.

public static void stopGenerateHar()

      • setPickerWheel

        @Then("^I pick \"(.*?)\" from \"(.*?)\" in the direction \"(.*?)\"$")
public static void setPickerWheel​(String value,
                                  String locator,
                                  String direction)
        Parameters:
        locator - - The pickerwheel element must be this specific type ("XCUIElementTypePickerWheel"), not “XCUIElementTypePicker” or any other parent/child of the pickerwheel.
        value - - value to compare this must be exact
        direction - - Direction to spin the spinner, either next or previous defaults to next

      • setNextPickerWheel

                                      String locator)
        Parameters:
        locator - - The pickerwheel element must be this specific type ("XCUIElementTypePickerWheel"), not “XCUIElementTypePicker” or any other parent/child of the pickerwheel.
        value - - value to compare this must be exact
